class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.revisions.Revision(config: dict, app: App)¶

Bases: BaseRecord

Revision Record ‘ndrevisions’ and ‘normalization’.

(change configuration &/or normalization state)

Parameters:

  • config (dict) – dictionary of things values from json

  • app (obj) – App()

Examples

>>> rev = fm.sm.revisions.filter(latest=True, deviceName='vSRX-2')[0]
>>> zip = rev.export()
>>> with open('export.zip', 'wb') as f:
...   f.write(zip)
...
36915
>>> zip = rev.export(meta=False)
>>> rev.delete()
True
delete() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Deletes an existing object.

Returns:

True if DELETE operation was successful.

Return type:

bool

Examples

>>> dev = fm.sm.devices.get(name='vsrx2')
>>> rev = dev.revisions.get(224)
>>> rev.delete()
True
>>>
export(meta: bool = True) → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Export a zip file contain the config data.

Support files include all NORMALIZED data and other meta data. Raw configs include only those files as found by Firemon during a retrieval.

Keyword Arguments:

meta (bool) – Include metadata and NORMALIZED config files

Returns:

zip file

Return type:

bytes

get_behavior_graphml() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Get the behavior model represented in a graphml format

nd_get(sections: list = []) → NormalizedData¶

Get normalized data as a fully parsed object

Retrieve all the revision data in a single payload.

Keyword Arguments:

sections (list) – different sections of Normalized Data to retrieve “empty” (default): every section “app”: “… etc”: all the different things

Returns:

NormalizedData

nd_problem() → bool | dict | str | bytes¶

Get problems with revision

class firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.revisions.Revisions(api: ~firemon_api.core.api.FiremonAPI, app: ~firemon_api.core.app.App, record=<class 'firemon_api.apps.securitymanager.revisions.Revision'>, device_id: int | None = None)¶

Bases: Endpoint

Revisions Endpoint. Combining ‘ndrevisions’ and ‘normalization’. Filtering is what it is. It is a mixture of revID, static domain requirements and device_id, or searching by a subset of our internal SIQL (but you cannot search by name or anything in SIQL).

Parameters:

  • api (obj) – FiremonAPI()

  • app (obj) – App()

Keyword Arguments:

  • record (obj) – default Record object

  • device_id (int) – Device id

Examples

>>> rev = fm.sm.revisions.get(34)
>>> rev = fm.sm.revisions.filter(latest=True, deviceName='vSRX-2')[0]
all() → list[Revision]¶

Returns:

a list of Revision()

Return type:

list[Revision]

property device_id¶
ep_name = 'rev'¶
filter(*args, **kwargs) → list[Revision]¶

Retrieve a filterd list of Revisions.

I have no idea how our /filter endpoint works. Some SIQL but I cannot find any decent documentation.

Parameters:

**kwargs – key value pairs in a device pack dictionary

Returns:

a list of Revision()

Return type:

list[Revision]

Examples

>>> fm.sm.dp.filter(latest=True)

FireMon-API is a Python web wrapper for the FireMon SIP (Security Mangager, etc...) APIs. The intent is make something that is useful for quick and easy development against FireMon products.
